sentences.sContent: He kissed the top of her head.
Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.sCn: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.sContent: They dived head first into the water.
She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.sCn: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.sContent: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.sCn: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.sContent: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.sCn: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

sentences.sContent: ...One of the creatures made a dramatic appearance by moving on to the head of the team leader as he slept...
...She said her grandmother reckoned you had to shave your head to get it out...
...Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick...
...The little boy walked out of the school with his head and shoulders hanging down...
...and generally head off with less ambitious plans...
...It means a lot to me and still in my head till this day...
...head of behavioral finance for Barclays Wealth Americas...
...dark question hanging over my head when seeking employment: should I tell my employers I have a condition...

synos.tran: [解剖]头；头痛；上端；最前的部分；理解力
前进；用头顶；作为…的首领；站在…的前头；给…加标题

phrases.pCn: n. 水头（水源）；水压；水位差；落差
在…的最前面；获最多的选票；在…的前面
头向外；出海；片头就位，片头朝外
领先；抢先起步的优势；有利的开端

words.tran: 兴奋的；任性的；性急的；顽固的；使人头晕的
不在意的；无头脑的；无领导者的
头球；页眉；数据头；收割台
能力；领导者的职位；校长的职位；职务
率领（head的过去分词）；朝向；走在…的前头

trans.tranOther: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc
